verses.text: Keep thy foot when thou goest to the house of God, and be more ready to hear, than to give the sacrifice of fools: for they consider not that they do evil.
Be not rash with thy mouth, and let not thy heart be hasty to utter \add any\add* thing before God: for God \add is\add* in heaven, and thou upon earth: therefore let thy words be few.
For a dream cometh through the multitude of business; and a fool's voice \add is known\add* by a multitude of words.
When thou vowest a vow to God, defer not to pay it; for \add he hath\add* no pleasure in fools: pay that which thou hast vowed.
Better \add is it\add* that thou shouldst not vow, than that thou shouldst vow and not pay.
Suffer not thy mouth to cause thy flesh to sin; neither say thou before the angel, that it \add was\add* an error: why should God be angry at thy voice, and destroy the work of thy hands?
For in the multitude of dreams and many words \add there are\add* also \add divers\add* vanities: but fear thou God.

If thou seest the oppression of the poor, and violent perversion of judgment and justice in a province, wonder not at the matter: for \add he that is\add* higher than the highest regardeth; and \add there are\add* higher than they.
Moreover, the profit of the earth is for all: the king \add himself\add* is served by the field.
He that loveth silver shall not be satisfied with silver; nor he that loveth abundance with increase: this \add is\add* also vanity.
When goods increase, they are increased that eat them: and what good \add is there\add* to the owners of them, saving the beholding \add of them\add* with their eyes?
The sleep of a laboring man \add is\add* sweet, whether he eateth little or much: but the abundance of the rich will not suffer him to sleep.
There is a grievous evil \add which\add* I have seen under the sun, \add namely\add* , riches kept for the owners of them to their hurt.
But those riches perish by evil labor: and he begetteth a son, and \add there is\add* nothing in his hand.
As he came into the world, naked shall he return to go as he came, and shall take nothing of his labor, which he may carry away in his hand.
And this also \add is\add* a grievous evil, \add that\add* in all points as he came, so shall he go: and what profit hath he that hath labored for the wind?
All his days also he eateth in darkness, and \add he hath\add* much sorrow and wrath with his sickness.

Behold \add that\add* which I have seen: \add it is\add* good and comely \add for one\add* to eat and to drink, and to enjoy the good of all his labor that he taketh under the sun all the days of his life, which God giveth him: for it \add is\add* his portion.
Every man also to whom God hath given riches and wealth, and hath given him power to eat of it, and to take his portion, and to rejoice in his labor; this \add is\add* the gift of God.
For he shall not much remember the days of his life; because God answereth \add him\add* in the joy of his heart.
